thread.title: Longfin Collapse Puts Focus on Lax IPO Rules

author: Jean Eaglesham
title: Longfin Collapse Puts Focus on Lax IPO Rules
text:
The most successful company to use post-financial crisis rules to list in the stock market has lost 85% of its value in six trading days, highlighting the risks for individual investors from a program designed to help small companies go public.

Longfin Corp., a financial technology company that does nearly all of its business in Singapore, listed its shares on Nasdaq in December.
